DOC.brief_title: A Study Effectiveness Safety Dapoxetine Treatment Men With Premature Ejaculation
DOC.detailed_description: Premature ejaculation ( PE ) form male sexual dysfunction . An objective measurement PE clinical study intravaginal ejaculatory latency time ( IELT ) . This multicenter , placebo-controlled , double-blind , randomize , parallel-group study men PE . The study consist 2 phase : pre-randomization phase ( screen visit 4-week baseline period ) ; 12-week double-blind treatment phase patient receive dapoxetine placebo use `` as-needed '' basis , post-study telephone contact approximately 2 week end treatment . The total duration study approximately 18 week . Assessments effectiveness include average intravaginal ejaculatory latency time ( measure stopwatch ) sexual intercourse , treatment period ; control ejaculation , satisfaction sexual intercourse , severity symptom , base question ask monthly interval treatment phase . Safety assessment include incidence , severity , type adverse event study , well laboratory test questionnaire monitor sexual function specify time study . The study hypothesis treatment 12 week dapoxetine prolongs intravaginal ejaculatory latency time , compare placebo , men PE . Oral tablet dapoxetine ( 30 milligram [ mg ] 60mg ) placebo take need 12 week treatment . No 1 dose within 24-hour period .
